page.title: 01AN INTRODUCTION TO THE AREA
page.content: Wigan is situated in the NW part of {Greater Manchester}and has undergone {major changes}during the last 25 years. The old economic base of{coal {mining, textiles}and{engineering}has declined to be replaced by light industries located mostly on estates or in converted mills. Wholesale{demolition}of "slum" terraced housing took place in the 1960's with large{council estates}and multi-storey flats built instead. There is new emphasis on{conservation both of the urban/industrial landscape and the semi-rural areas of{Haigh Hall {Country Park}and the{Douglas Valley. Within 5 miles of the town centre is the{agricultural area}of SW Lancs,with the{sea}10 miles further to the west. The town is{well connected}via the M6, M61, M57 and A580 roads and it is on the main London-Glasgow railway line.
